intro: Rubroshorea woodii, commonly known as the redshorea woodii, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many large trees found in Asian rainforests. The plant is characterized by its striking red-brown bark and glossy, dark green leaves. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and it is known for its unique ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
